bill.constitutionalAuthorityStatementText: [Congressional Record Volume 168, Number 98 (Wednesday, June 8, 2022)][House]From the Congressional Record Online through the Government Publishing Office [www.gpo.gov]By Mrs. MURPHY of Florida:H.R. 7985.Congress has the power to enact this legislation pursuantto the following:Article I, Section 8, Clause 1, which gives Congress thepower to lay and collect taxes and provide for the generalwelfare of the United States.Article 1, Section 8, Clause 3, which gives Congress thepower to regulate commerce with foreign nations.[Page H5409]

item.text: Referred to the Subcommittee on Trade.
Referred to the House Committee on Ways and Means.

summary.text:
Repeal Tariffs to Reduce Inflation Act of 2022

This bill requires the Department of the Treasury to report to Congress on the inflationary impact of tariffs and other trade restrictions (including impacts due to the expiration of preferential trade programs) for the period beginning on January 1, 2018, and ending on the date of this bill's enactment.

bill.title: Repeal Tariffs to Reduce Inflation Act of 2022

item.title: Repeal Tariffs to Reduce Inflation Act of 2022
Repeal Tariffs to Reduce Inflation Act of 2022
To require the Secretary of the Treasury to submit a report on the inflationary impact of certain tariffs, and for other purposes.

latestAction.text: Referred to the Subcommittee on Trade.

dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.
dublinCore.dc:contributor: Congressional Research Service, Library of Congress
dublinCore.dc:description: This file contains bill summaries and statuses for federal legislation. A bill summary describes the most significant provisions of a piece of legislation and details the effects the legislative text may have on current law and federal programs. Bill summaries are authored by the Congressional Research Service (CRS) of the Library of Congress. As stated in Public Law 91-510 (2 USC 166 (d)(6)), one of the duties of CRS is "to prepare summaries and digests of bills and resolutions of a public general nature introduced in the Senate or House of Representatives". For more information, refer to the User Guide that accompanies this file.
